response: * Woodford-Williams, Eluned (Lyn)  (1913–1984) Elected to the Society (1954), executive committee member (1958–69) . Born, Liverpool, United Kingdom, grew up there and in Wales.  Educated Liverpool College, Cardiff High School for Girls, Welsh National School of Medicine(BSc, 1933), University College Hospital, London (qualified 1936). Senior registrar and first assistant physician to Professor Oscar Olbrich (BSRA member elected) Sunderland Hospital. Established geriatric medicine at Sunderland and organised the 1958 meeting of the European Clinical Section of the International Association of Gerontology. With Professor Arthur Norman Exton-Smith founded the journal Gerontologia Clinica. A patron of modern Welsh art and culture, her collection of paintings was bequeathed to the National Museum of Wales upon her death.
